content:
Can you provide an overview of the three main components of natural language processing using a table?
|Component | Description | Example |
|---|---|---|
|Syntax | Deals with the structure of language | Identifying parts of speech |
|Semantics | Focuses on the meaning of language | Understanding the difference between "buy" and "sell" |
|Pragmatics | Considers the context in which language is used | Recognizing sarcasm or irony | 
So, what are the three main components of natural language processing?

Certainly! Here's an overview table of the three main components of natural language processing:

| Component | Description | Example |
|---|---|---|
| Syntax | Deals with the structure and grammatical arrangement of language | Identifying parts of speech, sentence parsing |
| Semantics | Focuses on the meaning and interpretation of words and sentences | Understanding word sense, disambiguation, and the difference between "buy" and "sell" |
| Pragmatics | Considers the context and situational factors in which language is used | Recognizing sarcasm, irony, or the speaker's intent |

These components work together to enable machines to understand and generate human language effectively.
